title: 106_s2514
content: The Act titled "Fairness for the Military Reserve Act of 2000" allows reserves to travel on military aircraft outside the continental United States. The Act "Fairness for the Military Reserve Act of 2000" enables reserves to travel on military aircraft outside the continental United States for annual training duty or inactive-duty training. Amendments include space-required and space-available travel regulations for Selected Reserve members and reserve retirees under age 60. The Defense Department will provide transportation on Department of Defense aircraft to eligible persons on a space-available basis, including Selected Reserve members and reserve retirees under age 60 eligible for retired pay. Dependents of eligible persons are also eligible for transportation under this provision. The Defense Department offers transportation on Department of Defense aircraft to eligible individuals on a space-available basis, including Selected Reserve members and reserve retirees under age 60 entitled to retired pay. Dependents of eligible individuals are also eligible for transportation without the need for specific identification forms. The Defense Department provides space-available travel for Selected Reserve members, reserve retirees under age 60, and their dependents. Regulations for this travel must be prescribed within 180 days of the enactment of the Act. Additionally, billeting services are available for Reserve members traveling for inactive duty training. The Secretary of Defense shall prescribe regulations allowing Reserves traveling to inactive-duty training over 50 miles from their residence to be eligible for billeting in Department of Defense facilities, similar to active duty members traveling under orders. Proof of eligibility must be provided as per the regulations. The Secretary of Defense will allow Reserves traveling to training over 50 miles to be eligible for billeting in Department of Defense facilities. The Secretary of Defense will allow Reserves attending inactive-duty training to be billeted in Department of Defense facilities, effective for training periods starting more than 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, there is an increase in the maximum number of reserve retirement points that can be credited in any year. Section 12733(3) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to limit the number of days of service for Reserve Component members. The amendment specifies different limits for different years of service, with a maximum of 90 days in a year of service after the enactment of the Reserve Components Equity Act of 2000. Additionally, there is a provision for legal services to Reserve Component members after they are released from active duty. Legal Services for members of reserve components of the armed forces are amended to provide coverage following release from active duty under a call or order to active duty for more than 30 days. Dependents are also included in the coverage. Regulations will be implemented to carry out these changes. Regulations to implement amendments for legal services for reserve component members and their dependents shall be prescribed within 180 days of the enactment of the Act.
